image.altText: Pieces of a helicopter strewn across a forest.

props.synopsis: The helicopter was travelling in heavy fog on the country's border with Azerbaijan when it suffered what state media described as a "hard landing".

title.children: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi and foreign minister killed in helicopter crash

image.altText: Unidentified uni students seen from behind.

props.synopsis: With a cap on international students each university can have announced by the Federal government, Tasmania's university is asking staff how it can save money.

title.children: Limit on international student numbers forces Tasmania's uni to embark on cost-cutting drive

image.altText: Screenshot of Pulse Tasmania Facebook post.

props.synopsis: A local media organisation has been reported to Equal Opportunity Tasmania, following concerns from the multicultural community that it did not do enough to moderate comments on a recent post.

title.children: Pulse Tasmania's Facebook page reported to anti-discrimination body over alleged racist comments on post

image.altText: A graphic of a girl with her hands behind her head, surrounded by messages saying "absolutely beautiful", "yum", "so hot".

props.synopsis: The rise of social media and child influencers has brought with it a murky underworld where men lust over kids in private chat channels and innocent images become deepfake pornography.Â

title.children: Adult 'fans' are subscribing for photos of an Australian child. Her parent runs the account

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: A new ASIC report says banks aren't doing what the law says they must do to help customers in trouble, as the proportion of borrowers in strife rises due to high interest rates, rocketing rents and increases in the cost of living.Â

title.children: 'Overcommitment' is the top reason for mortgage hardship amid a 54 per cent spike in claims

image.altText: A man with a white beard, wearing a black turban, sits at a desk in front of a framed portrate of Ayatollah Khomeini.

props.synopsis: Nuclear ambitions, animosity with Israel and a hard line on women made Ebrahim Raisi a likely successor to Iran'sÂ Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei.

title.children: Who was Iran's President Ebrahim Raisi?

image.altText: PROXY illustration flowers in brain

props.synopsis: Considering the rise in mental health crises in young women, a new approach is desperately needed.

title.children: Why are girls suffering so much right now? The problem is bigger than you think

image.altText: A hand holds a COVID-19 rapid antigen test. The test shows two lines, indicating a positive result.

props.synopsis: Here's what you need to know about providing evidence for sick leave when you have COVID-19.

title.children: Is a positive RAT sufficient evidence for sick leave if you have COVID?

image.altText: A large bee with black and blue stripes.

props.synopsis: Flowers, honey and plenty of produce: bees play a vital role in nature's ecosystem, and without them, we wouldn't have any of these things.Â

title.children: How to spot a native bee and what to do to help bolster populations. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: A group of Indian people at a beach.

props.synopsis: A visit to a much-loved beach represents a major milestone for international student Devarshi Deka, after an attack during a night out in Hobart that led to a months' long recovery. Generous supporters have since raised about $74,000 in donations towards his ongoing care and rehabilitation.

title.children: Beach milestone for Indian student left with disabilities after alleged attack in Hobart

image.altText: Close shot of a woman wearing a black collared shirt and red-rimmed glasses with hand on her chin

props.synopsis: After a 30-year career as an Australian food icon, Kylie Kwong announces she is closing her restaurant and quitting the business.

title.children: 'It's the right time': Chef Kylie Kwong announces end to 30-year career

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: Star Entertainment surges on Hard Rock takeover interest as ASX enjoys solid miner-led gains. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: Star Entertainment surges on takeover speculation, ASX up 0.6pc

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Troubled Star Entertainment jumps 20% on takeover speculation from Hard Rock Hotels
Casino operator Star gets takeover offer, shares halted

image.altText: A head and shoulders shot of a smiling Brett Maston against a beige background.

props.synopsis: Police in WA are searching for convicted armed robber Brett Maston, previously described as Australia's most wanted man, who they say has removed his electronic monitoring bracelet.

title.children: Armed robber once dubbed Australia's most wanted man at centre of new police manhunt

image.altText: A pregnant woman works at her desk.

props.synopsis: Buried in the federal budget papers is a figure that saves the bottom line almost half a billion dollars,Â but instead of being a happy story it reflects a demographic freight train coming for our country.

title.children: Amid accusations of ballooning government spending, one payment is on the decline â but it's not a happy story

image.altText: A man stands with his arms crossed in front of a bus.

props.synopsis: A West Australian council is taking legal action against Danny Reinhold to stop him living in his bus, parked on a friend's block.

title.children: Council takes legal action to evict pensioner living on converted bus

image.altText: Man who is a bald and has a beard sits in a warmly lit restaurant

props.synopsis: Shaun Christie-David is a radical restaurateur who's employing the "unemployable" and giving away thousands of free meals.Â

title.children: Shaun Christie-David owns six restaurants. But he's happy not to make a cent

image.altText: A blonde woman with a black sparkly dress on a red carpet

props.synopsis: The actress wrote on X that the CCTV of Sean "Diddy" Combs allegedly attacking his ex-partner brought up memories of her own experience of "severe" partner abuse.Â

title.children: Wicked and Glee star Kristin Chenoweth reveals she is a survivor of 'severe abuse' by ex-partner

image.altText: security video thumb sean combs diddy

props.synopsis: In a video on social media, the rapper apologises for the alleged assault on Cassie Ventura, in his first acknowledgement since a string of allegations against him began.Â

title.children: Diddy apologises and takes 'full responsibility' for CCTV video showing assault of ex

image.altText: Images from Virgin free cruise promotion Instagram reel.

props.synopsis: Virgin staff dancing at the boarding gate, a call from Richard Branson announcing they'd all won a free cruise, passengers wearing hats and filmed celebrating â but this winner says due to a change in itinerary, to claim her prize will cost her thousands.

title.children: Virgin passengers were told they'd won a free cruise, but some can't redeem the prize

image.altText: Mother sitting on floor of playroom with young child playing games

props.synopsis: There has been a 195 per cent increase in home school registrations in Queensland in the past five years, and this Rockhampton mother is opening her own Steiner school after seeking non-mainstream options for her daughters.Â

title.children: When Catrina couldn't find an alternative school for her daughter, she decided to start her own

image.altText: A sign on top of a building reads "lendlease".

props.synopsis: Corporate whistleblower Tony Watson says a small tweak to current whistleblower protection laws would significantly reduce his risk.Â Seven months on, nothing has changed.

title.children: Tony Watson blew the whistle on Lendlease's questionable tax practices. Now he has to sell his family home

image.altText: Dion Sternberg on the front lawn of a house.

props.synopsis: Power companies are skirting their obligations to warn households about major changes to the way they are charged for electricity courtesy of a "loophole" in Australia's energy rules.

title.children: 'Loophole' allows energy providers to change power tariffs without consumer consent

image.altText: Sharron Phillips was last seen at night at a telephone booth after her car ran out of fuel in Wacol in Brisbane's south in 1986.

title.children: 'Significant inconsistencies' with son's testimony claiming his father killed Sharron Phillips in 1986

image.altText: A woman looking at an old mobile phone device

props.synopsis: Lauren Trevan works for Queensland charity, DV Safe Phone, which repurposes old mobile phones and donates them to those experiencing digital abuse in the form of stalking and control through their existing devices.

title.children: Charity repurposing old phones to help free domestic violence victims from rising digital abuse

image.altText: A group of Chinese men sitting on the boat.

props.synopsis: A growing number of people are trying to leave China â some risking their lives at sea or in the jungle â as the country's political and economic future remains uncertain.Â

title.children: Disillusioned, desperate for cash and under pressure to pay bribes: China's emerging migration crisis

image.altText: A man sits on a couch holding a vile of Ozempic

props.synopsis: Australia's major health insurers are at odds over how to treat theÂ diabetes and weight loss medication Ozempic, with one insurer slashing benefits amid a worldwide shortage.

title.children: Insurer slashes rebates for Ozempic as private health funds navigate 'grey area' of 'vanity' use

image.altText: A screenshot of a man punching another man

props.synopsis: NASCAR rivalsÂ Ricky Stenhouse Jr and Kyle Busch threw punches after the former was taken out by the latter on lap two of the All-Star race.

title.children: Footage shows wild brawl erupting in the pits during NASCAR All-Star race

image.altText: Police in white cover-all suits stand in a passageway between units

props.synopsis: Police believe the 38-year-old had an access visit on the day and the boy's mother raised concerns when he was not returned as expected.

title.children: 'A more tragic event you wouldn't come across': Bodies of man and 2yo son found in Lismore unit

image.altText: A man in a wheelchair gives a thumbs up as a police officer wheels him out of a hospital.

props.synopsis: A 34-year-old man has been charged, accused of stabbing a male constable in the head after confronting two police officers on traffic dutiesÂ near Hyde Park in Sydney CBD.

title.children: Detectives trying to determine motive for stabbing of police officer in the head in Sydney's CBD

image.altText: Xander Schauffele holds up a lare silver trophy

props.synopsis: Xander Schauffele sinks a six-foot birdie putt on the 72nd hole to claim a one-shot win at the PGA Championship, winning his first career major.

title.children: Xander Schauffele wins first career major with birdie on the last hole of the PGA Championship

image.altText: a husband and wife with their toddler and young baby, plus a sausage dog, smile at the camera in a family photo

props.synopsis: HayleyÂ Ramsay-Watkinson now feels empowered with information about her reproductive health, but her knowledge was lacking until her late 20s. A fertility specialist says she isn't alone and the conversations should be had earlier.

title.children: Most people learn 'the fear of getting pregnant' from school sex ed. There's more to know

image.altText: The night sky with a green hue from a comet

props.synopsis: Preliminary analysis from the Spanish Calar Alto astronomical observatory found the blue fireball entered our atmosphere at a speed of 161,000kph.

title.children: 'Stunning' comet captured lighting up the sky over Spain and Portugal

image.altText: A bicycle rider rides away from the camera across a suspension bridge over a river.

props.synopsis: The same week a mountain-biking trail bridge across the Mersey River was installed, it washed away. A second, more sturdier version also washed away in another flood. Now it is hoped a third bridge will be the last.

title.children: Third time's the charm for council bridge repeatedly washed away in floods

image.altText: Emergency services crews walk under an awning at Martin Place, Sydney to attend to a gas leak

props.synopsis: The NSW government's pay offer applies to public sector workers whose industrial agreements are due for renewal, including firefighters, nurses and police.

title.children: NSW public servants offered 10.5 per cent pay rise, special 'inflation payments'

image.altText: A middle-aged, bearded man stands in front of several colourful bags hung on a wooden wall.

props.synopsis: David Pendleton makes and sells blankets, bags and pillows from recycled wool, but he has to source the fabric from India. He and others say it's time that changed.

title.children: This Victorian is on a mission to save old woollen clothes from landfill, one stitch at a time
